Publications

Publications, reports and articles I’ve been involved with on data science training, good data science and collaboration practices, and career pathways.

Data science practices and collaboration

Ten simple rules to cultivate transdisciplinary collaboration in data science F Sahneh et al, 2021
Good enough practices in scientific computing Wilson et al, 2017
Computing workflows for biologists: a roadmap A Shade & TK Teal, 2015
Journal of Open Source Software (JOSS): design and first-year review, AM Smith et al, 2018
11 ways to avert a data-storage disaster by Jeffrey Perkel, 1 April 2019 Nature
When it comes to reproducible science, Git is code for success by Jeffrey Perkel, 11 June 2018 Nature
Six tips for better spreadsheets by Jeffrey Perkel, 2 August 2022 Nature (paywall)

Data Science Training

Optimizing Short-format Training: an International Consensus on Effective, Inclusive, and Career-spanning Professional Development in the Life Sciences and Beyond JJ Williams et al, 2023
OECD Report: Building digital workforce capacity and skills for data-intensive science M Barker et al, 2020
Short-format workshops build skills and confidence for researchers to work with data KL Jordan et al, 2018
Data carpentry: workshops to increase data literacy for researchers Teal et al, 2015
Skills and knowledge for data-intensive environmental research SE Hampton et al, 2017
Data Science Drivers: A Report on the National Library of Medicine Workshop M Zaringhalam et al, 2018
A vision for collaborative training infrastructure for bioinformatics JJ Williams & TK Teal, 2016
Strategies for building computing skills to support microbiome analysis: a five-year perspective from the EDAMAME workshop A Shade et al, 2019

Career Pathways

data.org Pathways to Impact career journey interview by Perry Hewitt | 09 March 2023
An interview with UC Berkeley QB3 Professional in Residence Tracy Teal: harnessing community to support scientific research by Jonathan Liu | 01 March 2021
